thread.title: The ‘noise’ before 9/11

author: John Woodrow Cox
title: The ‘noise’ before 9/11
text:
Then-President George W. Bush in 2009. (Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images) October 23 at 4:57 PM Former ambassador and deputy secretary of state John D. Negroponte has a myopic memory of events leading up to the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks. In his Oct. 21 letter, he described as “noise” the state of intelligence concerning possible attacks against the United States before 9/11 and compared this “noise” to the various signals the U.S. government received concerning a possible attack at Pearl Harbor prior to the bombing. [“ Donald Trump and George W. Bush ”].
I beg to disagree. If Franklin D. Roosevelt had received a briefing from intelligence officials stating “Tojo determined to strike Pacific Fleet,” he would not have said, “You’ve covered your ass now,” which was
